comments:
The course presents a comprehensive overview of the global demand for energy,
and the resource availability and technology used in its current and future supply.
Through a personal energy audit, students are made aware of the extensive role that
energy plays in modern life, both directly, through electricity and transportation fuel, and
indirectly in the manufacturing of goods they use. The course covers how that energy is
supplied, the anticipated global growth in energy demand, the resources availability and
the role of science and technology in meeting that demand in a world concerned about
climate change. The roles of conservation, improved efficiency and renewable energy in
meeting future demand in a sustainable, environmentally benign way are covered.
Students found this class to be an “excellent overview” of energy systems. Quite a
few students felt that the quizzes were too “detail oriented” and the answers too rigid.
They suggested that the quizzes should focus on broader concepts instead.
Overall, students enjoyed Professor Jackson’s choice of topics and assignments.
However, they wished that the professor could provide more feedback on the
assignments.
Students did not find this course too difficult, but still thought that it required a
“considerable amount of work.” This class is recommended to anyone interested in
energy.
Fewer than eight student comments were submitted for this course.
